attributes.action: Have a vote of no confidence regarding the leadership of Teresa May
attributes.additional_details:
As the news has broken that we have the options of no Brexit or a bad deal the government has repeatedly ignored the possibility of exiting on a WTO agreement. 

The concession to Spain regarding Gibraltar is another action by Mrs May to roll over for the EU and show we will be a vassal in all but name.

This must stop.
attributes.background: Teresa May has repeatedly shown that she is not the prime minister that this country requires to lead us in a fair Brexit. Her repeated concessions regarding a backstop, and now Gibraltar has shown that she has no competence and is signing away our rights as a country.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers, including the Prime Minister, to be sacked or for a vote of no confidence.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that. 
Petitions calling for action on policy are more likely to be an effective way of achieving the change you want.
